document_data.name: ''Ring of Djinni Summoning''
document_data.mainbody: A '''''ring of djinni summoning''''', also sometimes called '''''ring of djinni calling''''', or simply '''''djinn ring''''', was a variant of a ''[[ring of genie summoning]]'' from [[Zakhara]], more common in [[Faerûn]], that could summon a particular [[djinni]] from the [[Elemental Plane of Air]].
document_data.Powers:
When activated via rubbing,{{Cite dragon/179/Wonders of the Land of Fate}} The ring would lose its magic if the djinni associated with it died.

Similar items were known to exist, like ''rings of efreeti calling'', that were identical to the ''rings of djinni summoning'', but summoned forth a different variety of a genie.

When observed through magic-detecting, ''rings of djinni summoning'' radiated powerful aura of [[conjuration]].
document_data.Creation: Creating a ''ring of djinni summoning'' required a heart of a [[great wyrm]] [[brass dragon]], valued at 25,000 [[gold]] [[coin|pieces]].{{Cite dragon/332/Cutting Up the Dragon|56}} The crafter should also be proficient at ring-making and creation of enchanted items, and being able to cast the ''gate'' [[spell]].
document_data.History: By the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]], it was illegal to own ''rings of djinni summoning'' in [[Calimport]] and was considered to be a capital crime.
document_data.Notable Owners:
*[[Akim el Ghasael]], a [[Pasha]], a [[cleric]], and an information broker from [[Calimport]] in the 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Aran Linvail]], the Shadowmaster of the [[Shadow Thieves]] in [[Athkatla]] during the [[Bhaalspawn crisis]].
*[[Aziz min Hajama]], the Captain of the [[Gate of Revelations]] in [[Huzuz]], in the 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Iltharagh]], a [[topaz dragon|topaz]] [[dracolich]], who laired north of [[Luskan]], owned a ''rings of djinni summoning'' in the late 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Iryklathagra]], a great [[blue dragon]], also known as Sharpfangs, had a ''ring of efreeti calling'' stashed away in her hoard in the [[Small Teeth]] mountains in the late 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Jonathon Morningmist]], a [[vampire]] in the mid-14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Osco Salibuck]], a [[hin]] [[thief]] from [[Waterdeep]] in the mid-14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Tertius Wands]], whose servant through a ring was the djinni [[Ampratines]] in the late 14{{th}} century DR.
*[[Tiamat]], the evil [[draconic]] [[deity]] owned one such ring, located in her hoard in the [[Abyss]].
*[[Tiralia]], an [[adventurer]] and a [[wizard]], part of the [[Iron Maidens]] in the 14{{th}} century DR.{{Cite polyhedron/55/The New Rogues Gallery: Iron Maidens|20}}
*[[Tyranthraxus]], kept a ''djinn ring'' in his lair within the ruins of [[Myth Drannor]] in the mid 14{{th}} century DR.
